description: Ms. codex. Title provided by cataloger. 19 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink, with use of red and yellow. Tables and diagrams (see fol. 15b, in red, yellow and black). Glazed laid paper with watermark. Table of contents by a later hand on the first flyleaf (fol. 1). Foliation in pencil using Western numerals (counting the first fly leaf as fol. 1). Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Riyāḍiyāt 124".
author: Umawī, Yaʻīsh ibn Ibrāhīm, active 15th century
contents: 1. fol. 2a-b: [Inscriptions ; recipes ; title "Kitāb lumʻat al-taʻrīf fī maʻná al-taṣārīf"].
2. fol. 3a-19b: Kanz al-asrār wa-dhakhīrat al-abrār / Hermes Trismegistus.
3. fol. 19b-26b: Lawāwiʻ al-taʻrīf fī maṭāliʻ al-taṣrīf / Yaʻīsh ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Andalūsī [Yaʻīsh ibn Ibrāhīm al-Umawī].
5. fol. 48b-61b: Sharḥ Junnat al-asmāʼ / Abū Ḥāmid al-Ghazzālī.
6. fol. 61b-62b: [Inscriptions ; recipes ; title "Kitāb Ḥajj? Aḥmad ibn Burhān"].
extent: 62 leaves: paper, ill. ; 211 x 152 (145 x 95) mm. bound to 217 x 165 mm.
creator: Umawī, Yaʻīsh ibn Ibrāhīm, active 15th century
اموي، يعيش بن ابراهيم
dlme_creator_ara_latn: Umawī, Yaʻīsh ibn Ibrāhīm, active 15th century
subject: Manuscripts, Arabic—New Jersey—Princeton
binding_note: Upper and lower covers and envelope flap made of brown leather over paper pasteboards. The upper and lower covers are similarly blind tooled with a central mandorla linked by a vertical and an horizontal single fillet to the outer frame, consisting of two double-fillets. The envelope flap has the same outer frame with a blind-tooled stamp on its pointe. Yellow paper pastedowns.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
